content: {{knowledge objective |Identifiant=OIC-049-16-A |Item_parent=Normal and pathological puberty |Item_parent_short=Normal and pathological puberty |Rank=A |Title=Defining delayed puberty in boys and girls |Description=None |Rubric=Positive diagnosis |Contributors= |Order=16}} Delayed puberty is defined as the absence of breast development after the age of 13 in a girl or testicular enlargement after the age of 14 in a boy.

question.title: What is the definition of delayed puberty in boys and girls?
question.description: Delayed puberty is defined as the absence of breast development after the age of 13 in a girl or testicular enlargement after the age of 14 in a boy.

option_a.title: The absence of breast development after the age of 15 in a girl or testicular enlargement after the age of 15 in a boy

option_b.title: The absence of breast development after the age of 13 in a girl or testicular enlargement after the age of 14 in a boy

option_c.title: The presence of breast development before the age of 12 in a girl or testicular enlargement before the age of 13 in a boy

option_d.title: The presence of breast development after the age of 16 in a girl or testicular enlargement after the age of 16 in a boy
